speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: SCENE III. The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Sennet. Enter AGAMEMNON, NESTOR, ULYSSES, MENELAUS, and others

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Princes,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: What grief hath set the jaundice on your cheeks?

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: The ample proposition that hope makes

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: In all designs begun on earth below

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Fails in the promised largeness: cheques and disasters

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Grow in the veins of actions highest rear'd,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: As knots, by the conflux of meeting sap,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Infect the sound pine and divert his grain

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Tortive and errant from his course of growth.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Nor, princes, is it matter new to us

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: That we come short of our suppose so far

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: That after seven years' siege yet Troy walls stand;

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Sith every action that hath gone before,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Whereof we have record, trial did draw

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Bias and thwart, not answering the aim,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: And that unbodied figure of the thought

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: That gave't surmised shape. Why then, you princes,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Do you with cheeks abash'd behold our works,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: And call them shames? which are indeed nought else

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: But the protractive trials of great Jove

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: To find persistive constancy in men:

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: The fineness of which metal is not found

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: In fortune's love; for then the bold and coward,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: The wise and fool, the artist and unread,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: The hard and soft seem all affined and kin:

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: But, in the wind and tempest of her frown,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Distinction, with a broad and powerful fan,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Puffing at all, winnows the light away;

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: And what hath mass or matter, by itself

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Lies rich in virtue and unmingled.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: With due observance of thy godlike seat,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Great Agamemnon, Nestor shall apply

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Thy latest words. In the reproof of chance

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Lies the true proof of men: the sea being smooth,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: How many shallow bauble boats dare sail

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Upon her patient breast, making their way

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: With those of nobler bulk!

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: But let the ruffian Boreas once enrage

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: The gentle Thetis, and anon behold

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: The strong-ribb'd bark through liquid mountains cut,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Bounding between the two moist elements,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Like Perseus' horse: where's then the saucy boat

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Whose weak untimber'd sides but even now

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Co-rivall'd greatness? Either to harbour fled,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Or made a toast for Neptune. Even so

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Doth valour's show and valour's worth divide

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: In storms of fortune; for in her ray and brightness

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: The herd hath more annoyance by the breeze

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Than by the tiger; but when the splitting wind

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Makes flexible the knees of knotted oaks,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And flies fled under shade, why, then the thing of courage

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: As roused with rage with rage doth sympathize,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And with an accent tuned in selfsame key

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Retorts to chiding fortune.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Agamemnon,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Thou great commander, nerve and bone of Greece,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Heart of our numbers, soul and only spirit.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: In whom the tempers and the minds of all

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Should be shut up, hear what Ulysses speaks.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Besides the applause and approbation To which,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: To AGAMEMNON

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: most mighty for thy place and sway,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: To NESTOR

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And thou most reverend for thy stretch'd-out life

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: I give to both your speeches, which were such

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: As Agamemnon and the hand of Greece

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Should hold up high in brass, and such again

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: As venerable Nestor, hatch'd in silver,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Should with a bond of air, strong as the axle-tree

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: On which heaven rides, knit all the Greekish ears

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: To his experienced tongue, yet let it please both,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Thou great, and wise, to hear Ulysses speak.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Speak, prince of Ithaca; and be't of less expect

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: That matter needless, of importless burden,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Divide thy lips, than we are confident,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: When rank Thersites opes his mastic jaws,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: We shall hear music, wit and oracle.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Troy, yet upon his basis, had been down,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And the great Hector's sword had lack'd a master,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: But for these instances.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The specialty of rule hath been neglected:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And, look, how many Grecian tents do stand

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Hollow upon this plain, so many hollow factions.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: When that the general is not like the hive

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: To whom the foragers shall all repair,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: What honey is expected? Degree being vizarded,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The unworthiest shows as fairly in the mask.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The heavens themselves, the planets and this centre

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Observe degree, priority and place,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Insisture, course, proportion, season, form,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Office and custom, in all line of order;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And therefore is the glorious planet Sol

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: In noble eminence enthroned and sphered

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Amidst the other; whose medicinable eye

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Corrects the ill aspects of planets evil,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And posts, like the commandment of a king,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Sans cheque to good and bad: but when the planets

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: In evil mixture to disorder wander,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: What plagues and what portents! what mutiny!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: What raging of the sea! shaking of earth!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Commotion in the winds! frights, changes, horrors,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Divert and crack, rend and deracinate

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The unity and married calm of states

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Quite from their fixure! O, when degree is shaked,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Which is the ladder to all high designs,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Then enterprise is sick! How could communities,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Degrees in schools and brotherhoods in cities,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Peaceful commerce from dividable shores,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The primogenitive and due of birth,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Prerogative of age, crowns, sceptres, laurels,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: But by degree, stand in authentic place?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Take but degree away, untune that string,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And, hark, what discord follows! each thing meets

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: In mere oppugnancy: the bounded waters

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Should lift their bosoms higher than the shores

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And make a sop of all this solid globe:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Strength should be lord of imbecility,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And the rude son should strike his father dead:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Force should be right; or rather, right and wrong,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Between whose endless jar justice resides,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Should lose their names, and so should justice too.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Then every thing includes itself in power,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Power into will, will into appetite;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And appetite, an universal wolf,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: So doubly seconded with will and power,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Must make perforce an universal prey,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And last eat up himself. Great Agamemnon,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: This chaos, when degree is suffocate,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Follows the choking.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And this neglection of degree it is

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: That by a pace goes backward, with a purpose

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: It hath to climb. The general's disdain'd

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: By him one step below, he by the next,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: That next by him beneath; so every step,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Exampled by the first pace that is sick

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Of his superior, grows to an envious fever

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Of pale and bloodless emulation:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And 'tis this fever that keeps Troy on foot,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Not her own sinews. To end a tale of length,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Troy in our weakness stands, not in her strength.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Most wisely hath Ulysses here discover'd

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: The fever whereof all our power is sick.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: The nature of the sickness found, Ulysses,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: What is the remedy?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The great Achilles, whom opinion crowns

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The sinew and the forehand of our host,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Having his ear full of his airy fame,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Grows dainty of his worth, and in his tent

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Lies mocking our designs: with him Patroclus

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Upon a lazy bed the livelong day

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Breaks scurril jests;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And with ridiculous and awkward action,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Which, slanderer, he imitation calls,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: He pageants us. Sometime, great Agamemnon,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Thy topless deputation he puts on,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And, like a strutting player, whose conceit

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Lies in his hamstring, and doth think it rich

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: To hear the wooden dialogue and sound

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: 'Twixt his stretch'd footing and the scaffoldage,--

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Such to-be-pitied and o'er-wrested seeming

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: He acts thy greatness in: and when he speaks,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: 'Tis like a chime a-mending; with terms unsquared,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Which, from the tongue of roaring Typhon dropp'd

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Would seem hyperboles. At this fusty stuff

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The large Achilles, on his press'd bed lolling,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: From his deep chest laughs out a loud applause;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Cries 'Excellent! 'tis Agamemnon just.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Now play me Nestor; hem, and stroke thy beard,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: As he being drest to some oration.'

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: That's done, as near as the extremest ends

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Of parallels, as like as Vulcan and his wife:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Yet god Achilles still cries 'Excellent!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: 'Tis Nestor right. Now play him me, Patroclus,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Arming to answer in a night alarm.'

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And then, forsooth, the faint defects of age

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Must be the scene of mirth; to cough and spit,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And, with a palsy-fumbling on his gorget,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Shake in and out the rivet: and at this sport

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Sir Valour dies; cries 'O, enough, Patroclus;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Or give me ribs of steel! I shall split all

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: In pleasure of my spleen.' And in this fashion,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: All our abilities, gifts, natures, shapes,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Severals and generals of grace exact,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Achievements, plots, orders, preventions,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Excitements to the field, or speech for truce,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Success or loss, what is or is not, serves

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: As stuff for these two to make paradoxes.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And in the imitation of these twain--

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Who, as Ulysses says, opinion crowns

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: With an imperial voice--many are infect.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Ajax is grown self-will'd, and bears his head

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: In such a rein, in full as proud a place

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: As broad Achilles; keeps his tent like him;

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Makes factious feasts; rails on our state of war,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Bold as an oracle, and sets Thersites,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: A slave whose gall coins slanders like a mint,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: To match us in comparisons with dirt,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: To weaken and discredit our exposure,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: How rank soever rounded in with danger.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: They tax our policy, and call it cowardice,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Count wisdom as no member of the war,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Forestall prescience, and esteem no act

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: But that of hand: the still and mental parts,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: That do contrive how many hands shall strike,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: When fitness calls them on, and know by measure

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Of their observant toil the enemies' weight,--

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Why, this hath not a finger's dignity:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: They call this bed-work, mappery, closet-war;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: So that the ram that batters down the wall,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: For the great swing and rudeness of his poise,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: They place before his hand that made the engine,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Or those that with the fineness of their souls

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: By reason guide his execution.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Let this be granted, and Achilles' horse

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Makes many Thetis' sons.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: A tucket

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: What trumpet? look, Menelaus.

speaker: MENELAUS
text_entry: From Troy.

speaker: MENELAUS
text_entry: Enter AENEAS

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: What would you 'fore our tent?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Is this great Agamemnon's tent, I pray you?

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Even this.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: May one, that is a herald and a prince,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Do a fair message to his kingly ears?

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: With surety stronger than Achilles' arm

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: 'Fore all the Greekish heads, which with one voice

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Call Agamemnon head and general.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Fair leave and large security. How may

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: A stranger to those most imperial looks

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Know them from eyes of other mortals?

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: How!

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Ay;

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: I ask, that I might waken reverence,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: And bid the cheek be ready with a blush

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Modest as morning when she coldly eyes

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: The youthful Phoebus:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Which is that god in office, guiding men?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Which is the high and mighty Agamemnon?

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: This Trojan scorns us; or the men of Troy

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Are ceremonious courtiers.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Courtiers as free, as debonair, unarm'd,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: As bending angels; that's their fame in peace:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: But when they would seem soldiers, they have galls,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Good arms, strong joints, true swords; and,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Jove's accord,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Nothing so full of heart. But peace, AEneas,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Peace, Trojan; lay thy finger on thy lips!

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: The worthiness of praise distains his worth,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: If that the praised himself bring the praise forth:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: But what the repining enemy commends,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: That breath fame blows; that praise, sole sure,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: transcends.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Sir, you of Troy, call you yourself AEneas?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Ay, Greek, that is my name.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: What's your affair I pray you?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Sir, pardon; 'tis for Agamemnon's ears.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: He hears naught privately that comes from Troy.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Nor I from Troy come not to whisper him:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: I bring a trumpet to awake his ear,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: To set his sense on the attentive bent,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: And then to speak.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Speak frankly as the wind;

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: It is not Agamemnon's sleeping hour:

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: That thou shalt know. Trojan, he is awake,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: He tells thee so himself.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Trumpet, blow loud,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Send thy brass voice through all these lazy tents;

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: And every Greek of mettle, let him know,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: What Troy means fairly shall be spoke aloud.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Trumpet sounds

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: We have, great Agamemnon, here in Troy

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: A prince call'd Hector,--Priam is his father,--

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Who in this dull and long-continued truce

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Is rusty grown: he bade me take a trumpet,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: And to this purpose speak. Kings, princes, lords!

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: If there be one among the fair'st of Greece

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: That holds his honour higher than his ease,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: That seeks his praise more than he fears his peril,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: That knows his valour, and knows not his fear,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: That loves his mistress more than in confession,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: With truant vows to her own lips he loves,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: And dare avow her beauty and her worth

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: In other arms than hers,--to him this challenge.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Hector, in view of Trojans and of Greeks,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Shall make it good, or do his best to do it,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: He hath a lady, wiser, fairer, truer,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Than ever Greek did compass in his arms,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: And will to-morrow with his trumpet call

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Midway between your tents and walls of Troy,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: To rouse a Grecian that is true in love:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: If any come, Hector shall honour him;

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: If none, he'll say in Troy when he retires,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: The Grecian dames are sunburnt and not worth

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: The splinter of a lance. Even so much.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: This shall be told our lovers, Lord AEneas;

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: If none of them have soul in such a kind,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: We left them all at home: but we are soldiers;

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: And may that soldier a mere recreant prove,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: That means not, hath not, or is not in love!

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: If then one is, or hath, or means to be,

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: That one meets Hector; if none else, I am he.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Tell him of Nestor, one that was a man

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: When Hector's grandsire suck'd: he is old now;

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: But if there be not in our Grecian host

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: One noble man that hath one spark of fire,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: To answer for his love, tell him from me

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: I'll hide my silver beard in a gold beaver

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And in my vantbrace put this wither'd brawn,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And meeting him will tell him that my lady

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Was fairer than his grandam and as chaste

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: As may be in the world: his youth in flood,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: I'll prove this truth with my three drops of blood.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Now heavens forbid such scarcity of youth!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Amen.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Fair Lord AEneas, let me touch your hand;

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: To our pavilion shall I lead you, sir.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Achilles shall have word of this intent;

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: So shall each lord of Greece, from tent to tent:

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Yourself shall feast with us before you go

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: And find the welcome of a noble foe.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Exeunt all but ULYSSES and NESTOR

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Nestor!

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: What says Ulysses?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: I have a young conception in my brain;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Be you my time to bring it to some shape.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: What is't?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: This 'tis:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Blunt wedges rive hard knots: the seeded pride

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: That hath to this maturity blown up

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: In rank Achilles must or now be cropp'd,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Or, shedding, breed a nursery of like evil,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: To overbulk us all.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Well, and how?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: This challenge that the gallant Hector sends,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: However it is spread in general name,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Relates in purpose only to Achilles.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: The purpose is perspicuous even as substance,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Whose grossness little characters sum up:

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And, in the publication, make no strain,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: But that Achilles, were his brain as barren

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: As banks of Libya,--though, Apollo knows,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: 'Tis dry enough,--will, with great speed of judgment,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Ay, with celerity, find Hector's purpose

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Pointing on him.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And wake him to the answer, think you?

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Yes, 'tis most meet: whom may you else oppose,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: That can from Hector bring his honour off,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: If not Achilles? Though't be a sportful combat,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Yet in the trial much opinion dwells;

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: For here the Trojans taste our dear'st repute

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: With their finest palate: and trust to me, Ulysses,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Our imputation shall be oddly poised

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: In this wild action; for the success,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Although particular, shall give a scantling

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Of good or bad unto the general;

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And in such indexes, although small pricks

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: To their subsequent volumes, there is seen

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: The baby figure of the giant mass

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Of things to come at large. It is supposed

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: He that meets Hector issues from our choice

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And choice, being mutual act of all our souls,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Makes merit her election, and doth boil,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: As 'twere from us all, a man distill'd

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Out of our virtues; who miscarrying,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: What heart receives from hence the conquering part,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: To steel a strong opinion to themselves?

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Which entertain'd, limbs are his instruments,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: In no less working than are swords and bows

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Directive by the limbs.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Give pardon to my speech:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Therefore 'tis meet Achilles meet not Hector.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Let us, like merchants, show our foulest wares,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And think, perchance, they'll sell; if not,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The lustre of the better yet to show,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Shall show the better. Do not consent

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: That ever Hector and Achilles meet;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: For both our honour and our shame in this

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Are dogg'd with two strange followers.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: I see them not with my old eyes: what are they?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: What glory our Achilles shares from Hector,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Were he not proud, we all should share with him:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: But he already is too insolent;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: A nd we were better parch in Afric sun

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Than in the pride and salt scorn of his eyes,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Should he 'scape Hector fair: if he were foil'd,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Why then, we did our main opinion crush

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: In taint of our best man. No, make a lottery;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: And, by device, let blockish Ajax draw

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The sort to fight with Hector: among ourselves

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Give him allowance for the better man;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: For that will physic the great Myrmidon

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Who broils in loud applause, and make him fall

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: His crest that prouder than blue Iris bends.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: If the dull brainless Ajax come safe off,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: We'll dress him up in voices: if he fail,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Yet go we under our opinion still

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: That we have better men. But, hit or miss,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Our project's life this shape of sense assumes:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Ajax employ'd plucks down Achilles' plumes.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Ulysses,

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Now I begin to relish thy advice;

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: And I will give a taste of it forthwith

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: To Agamemnon: go we to him straight.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Two curs shall tame each other: pride alone

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Must tarre the mastiffs on, as 'twere their bone.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Exeunt
